message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.DL, cs.LG, cs.CY 

The paper discusses the application of computational linguistics techniques to astronomy literature, which suggests that it belongs to the natural language processing (NLP) subfield of computer science. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves information retrieval (IR) techniques to find similar articles, which makes cs.IR (Information Retrieval) another likely sub-category. The use of machine learning techniques for processing literature dissemination suggests that cs.DL (Deep Learning) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) are also possible sub-categories. Finally, the paper involves the analysis of large amounts of data, which could fall under the sub-category of cs.CY (Computers and Society).
